page.title: 14MARYC.MEDIA LOCAL MAGAZINE
page.content: The first edition of the South Deeside Review was printed in Blairs College in 1981. Copies of the 12-page booklet are now distributed free to 876 homes in the area. There are two co-editors and five people responsible for the gathering of material. It has carried articles on local history, literary contributions as well as news from schools in the locality, given publicity for events such as the raising of money for a hall where organisations might meet. It has helped formulate public attitudes towards the provision of sheltered housing, and the prevention of quarrying operations which would have been detrimental to the amenity of the neighbourhood. It is now printed in Aberdeen.
